byline.contributor: Al Baker and Benjamin Mueller contributed reporting.

abstract: Tyrone Howard, suspect accused of shooting New York City Police Officer Randolph Holder, was rejected from drug treatment program in 2011 because judge felt he was violent criminal; Howard was approved for same program in May by different judge; case has raised questions about efficacy of drug diversion programs.
lead_paragraph: Tyrone Howard was sent to a drug-treatment program a few months before he allegedly killed Officer Randolph Holder on Tuesday but had been rejected for the same program four years ago.

headline.main: Suspect in Officer’s Killing Was Deemed Too Violent for Drug Treatment in 2011
headline.print_headline: Suspect in Officer’s Death Was Deemed Too Risky for Drug Treatment in 2011

snippet: Tyrone Howard was sent to a drug-treatment program a few months before he allegedly killed Officer Randolph Holder on Tuesday but had been rejected for the same program four years ago.
